item.description:
Anyone who loves French food and appreciates French history knows that July 14 is Bastille Day, when the people of Paris stormed the Bastille fortress and prison and started the chain of events that dissolved the French monarchy and led to the evolution of the French republic. Let's get together and celebrate it at the Petit Robert Bistro in Needham.

I think it would be great fun if each person brought along the name of some major institution or symbol that they would personally like to storm/destroy/reinvent and is prepared to tell us why. It should make for interesting conversation. But it's not a requirement! Just bring along your appetite -- and maybe a French dictionary or two.

As usual, your $3 reservation fee will be added into the tax and tip portion of the bill and credited to you when I add everything up.
item.how_to_find_us: Reservation is in Kathy Rotchford's name
item.name: Bastille Day Dinner at Petit Robert Bistro
